snippet: The campaign against Senator Claire McCaskill of Missouri, fueled by tax-exempt groups backing Republican candidates, may be a precursor to such efforts on a broader scale.
abstract: Sustained campaign attack against Democratic incumbent Sen Claire McCaskill in MIssouri, fueled by tax-exempt groups backing Republican candidates, could become a textbook for future efforts in a new era of anything-goes campaign financing; money has flowed in largely to take down the Democrat, providing vital air cover while the Republicans fight each other below the radar; three Republican candidates may be lesser known and less dynamic than McCaskill, but she is possibly the most endangered incumbent in the Senate.
lead_paragraph: The campaign against Senator Claire McCaskill of Missouri, fueled by tax-exempt groups backing Republican candidates, may be a precursor to such efforts on a broader scale.

headline.seo: In Missouri Senate Race, Ads Beset Incumbent Democrat
headline.main: Outside Cash in Missouri Race Could Be a National Model
headline.print_headline: Outside Cash in Missouri Race Could Act as National Model
